title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0001
text: What does 'decompose by business capability' mean in microservice architecture?

options.text: Dividing services based on distinct business functions or domains
Splitting services by technical layers like UI and database
Grouping all services into a single monolith

explanation: Decomposing by business capability means structuring services around distinct business functions or domains rather than technical layers.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0002
text: What is the main goal of decomposing by business capability?

options.text: To align services with business functions for better autonomy
To reduce the number of services

explanation: The goal is to align services with business functions, enabling autonomy and clear ownership.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0003
text: Which of the following best describes a business capability?

options.text: A high-level business function that delivers value
A technical component like a database

explanation: A business capability represents a high-level business function that contributes to delivering value.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0004
text: Which of the following is an example of a business capability?
explanation: Order Management is a business capability because it represents a core business function.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0005
text: Why is decomposing by business capability preferred over technical decomposition?

options.text: It aligns services with business goals and reduces coupling
It reduces the number of APIs

explanation: Decomposing by business capability aligns services with business goals and reduces inter-service coupling.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0006
text: What is a key benefit of decomposing by business capability?
explanation: Decomposing by business capability improves autonomy and ownership by aligning services with business domains.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0007
text: Which of the following is a challenge when decomposing by business capability?
explanation: Identifying clear business boundaries is often challenging when decomposing by business capability.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0008
text: Which of the following best describes the relationship between business capabilities and microservices?

options.text: Each microservice should represent a single business capability
Each microservice should represent multiple unrelated capabilities
All microservices should share the same capability

explanation: Each microservice should represent a single business capability to maintain clear boundaries and focus.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0009
text: What is the main advantage of aligning microservices with business capabilities?

options.text: It allows teams to work independently on specific business areas
It reduces the number of APIs

explanation: Aligning microservices with business capabilities allows teams to work independently on specific business areas.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0010
text: Which of the following is a sign that a service boundary is not aligned with a business capability?

options.text: Frequent cross-service communication for basic operations

explanation: Frequent cross-service communication indicates that service boundaries may not align with business capabilities.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0011
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for scalability?

options.text: Each business capability can scale independently
Scaling is limited to the database

explanation: Decomposing by business capability allows independent scaling of services based on business needs.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0012
text: Which of the following is a common approach to identifying business capabilities?

options.text: Analyzing business processes and value streams

explanation: Business capabilities are identified by analyzing business processes and value streams.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0013
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for maintainability?

options.text: Simplifies maintenance by isolating business logic
Centralizes all logic in one service

explanation: Decomposing by business capability simplifies maintenance by isolating business logic within each service.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0014
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of decomposing by business capability?

options.text: It can be difficult to identify clear boundaries

explanation: Identifying clear boundaries between business capabilities can be challenging during decomposition.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0015
text: Which of the following is a key principle when decomposing by business capability?

options.text: Each service should encapsulate a single business function
Each service should handle multiple unrelated functions
All services should share the same database
Services should be grouped by technology

explanation: Each service should encapsulate a single business function to maintain clear boundaries and autonomy.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0016
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for team structure?

options.text: Teams can own and manage specific business capabilities
Teams must share ownership of all services
Teams are organized by technology stack

explanation: Decomposing by business capability allows teams to own and manage specific business areas independently.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0017
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for agility?

options.text: Enables faster delivery of business features

explanation: Decomposing by business capability enables faster delivery of business features by reducing dependencies.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0018
text: Which of the following is a common mistake when decomposing by business capability?

options.text: Splitting services by technical layers instead of business functions

explanation: A common mistake is splitting services by technical layers instead of aligning them with business functions.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0019
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for fault isolation?

options.text: Failures are contained within specific business areas
All services share the same process

explanation: Decomposing by business capability improves fault isolation by containing failures within specific business areas.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0020
text: Which of the following best describes the outcome of decomposing by business capability?

options.text: Services aligned with business domains and independently deployable

explanation: Decomposing by business capability results in services aligned with business domains and independently deployable.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0021
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for scalability?

options.text: Each business capability can scale independently
Scaling requires redeploying the entire system
Scaling is limited to the database

explanation: Decomposing by business capability allows independent scaling of services based on business demand.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0022
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of decomposing by business capability?

options.text: Requires deep understanding of business domains

explanation: Decomposing by business capability requires a deep understanding of business domains, which can be complex.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0023
text: Which of the following is a key indicator of a well-defined business capability boundary?
explanation: A well-defined business capability boundary minimizes dependencies and cross-service communication.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0024
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for team autonomy?

options.text: Teams can own and deploy their services independently

explanation: Decomposing by business capability allows teams to own and deploy their services independently.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0025
text: Which of the following is a common tool used to identify business capabilities?
explanation: Domain-Driven Design (DDD) is commonly used to identify and define business capabilities and service boundaries.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0026
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for fault tolerance?

options.text: Failures are isolated within specific business domains
All services share the same process

explanation: Decomposing by business capability improves fault tolerance by isolating failures within specific domains.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0027
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for agility?

options.text: Enables faster delivery of business features

explanation: Decomposing by business capability enables faster delivery of business features by reducing dependencies.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0028
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for maintainability?

options.text: Simplifies maintenance by isolating business logic
Centralizes all logic in one service

explanation: Decomposing by business capability simplifies maintenance by isolating business logic within each service.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0029
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for scalability?

options.text: Each business capability can scale independently
Scaling requires redeploying the entire system
Scaling is limited to the database

explanation: Decomposing by business capability allows independent scaling of services based on business demand.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0030
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for testing?

options.text: Testing can focus on individual business areas

explanation: Decomposing by business capability allows testing to focus on individual business areas, improving efficiency.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0031
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for deployment?

options.text: Each business capability can be deployed independently
All services must be deployed together

explanation: Decomposing by business capability allows independent deployment of services, enabling faster releases.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0032
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for ownership?
explanation: Decomposing by business capability provides clear ownership of business functions to specific teams.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0033
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for fault isolation?

options.text: Failures are contained within specific business areas
All services share the same process

explanation: Decomposing by business capability improves fault isolation by containing failures within specific business areas.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0034
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for flexibility?

options.text: Allows independent evolution of business areas

explanation: Decomposing by business capability allows independent evolution of business areas without affecting others.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0035
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for resilience?

options.text: Each business capability can recover independently

explanation: Decomposing by business capability improves resilience by allowing independent recovery of services.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0036
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for innovation?

options.text: Teams can experiment with new technologies independently
All teams must use the same tools

explanation: Decomposing by business capability fosters innovation by allowing teams to experiment independently.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0037
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for continuous delivery?
explanation: Decomposing by business capability supports continuous delivery by enabling frequent and independent releases.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0038
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for modularity?

options.text: Each service is modular and focused on a single business function

explanation: Decomposing by business capability promotes modularity by designing each service around a single business function.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0039
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for observability?

options.text: Provides visibility into specific business areas

explanation: Decomposing by business capability improves observability by providing visibility into specific business areas.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0040
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for alignment?

options.text: Aligns technical architecture with business goals

explanation: Decomposing by business capability aligns technical architecture with business goals and outcomes.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0041
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for testing?

options.text: Testing can focus on individual business areas

explanation: Decomposing by business capability allows testing to focus on individual business areas, improving efficiency.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0042
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for continuous integration?

options.text: Supports independent CI pipelines per service
Requires a single CI pipeline for all services

explanation: Decomposing by business capability supports independent CI pipelines, allowing faster and isolated builds.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0043
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for risk reduction?

options.text: Reduces risk of breaking unrelated business areas

explanation: Decomposing by business capability reduces risk by isolating changes to specific business areas.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0044
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for performance?

options.text: Optimizations can be applied to specific business services

explanation: Decomposing by business capability allows performance optimizations to target specific business services.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0045
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for modular design?

options.text: Each service is modular and focused on a single business function

explanation: Decomposing by business capability promotes modular design by focusing each service on a single business function.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0046
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for transparency?
explanation: Decomposing by business capability improves transparency by providing visibility into business operations.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0047
text: Which of the following best describes decomposing by business capability?

options.text: Structuring services around business functions rather than technical layers
Combining all services into one monolith

explanation: Decomposing by business capability structures services around business functions rather than technical layers.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0048
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for alignment with business strategy?

options.text: Ensures technical architecture supports business goals

explanation: Decomposing by business capability ensures that technical architecture supports business goals and strategy.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0049
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by business capability for adaptability?

options.text: Allows quick adaptation to business changes

explanation: Decomposing by business capability allows quick adaptation to business changes without affecting other services.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesBusinessCapability - Q0050
text: Which of the following best summarizes the purpose of decomposing by business capability?

options.text: To align microservices with business functions for autonomy and scalability
To group services by technical layers
To reduce the number of services

explanation: The purpose of decomposing by business capability is to align microservices with business functions for autonomy and scalability.
